g.text: In the previous report, we co-introduced a construct for gRNA expression with a 2
promoter and another for the expression of human-codon-optimized
) to reconstruct a CRISPR/Cas9 system in
succeeded in obtaining plants whose target locus was edited [25]. However, the
genome editing efficiency was very low, under 0.5%; that is, only a few plants with
genome editing events were obtained for each co-transformation of sporelings derived
from two sporangia. To improve the genome editing efficiency to a practical level, we
examined the effects of codon optimization by replacing
terminator was also replaced by the
terminator [12], this difference seems negligible (unpublished data)). In this new Cas9

(Fig. 1A) [32]. For the expression of a gRNA, the same gRNA
expression vector used in the previous study was again utilized [25].
To evaluate genome-editing efficiencies, we firstly chose the Mp
) transcription factor as a target, which had been used
in the previous report [25 , 33]. Since Mp
mutants are known to show an NAA
resistant phenotype [34, 35], auxin-resistant T1 transformants with mutations in the
locus can be positively selected. The gRNA expression plasmid for
, pMpGWB301_ARF1_1, which had previously been proved to be effective
[25], was also used in this experiment (Figs. 1A, S2). A single co-transformation of
sporelings with pMpGE006 and pMpGWB301_ARF1_1 yielded hundreds of NAA-
resistant plants (Figs. 1B, S3), whereas the same experiment with the
